intro: Peplis tithymaloides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tithymal, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, yellowish flowers are arranged in a flat-topped cluster, and the leaves are narrow and often hairy. It is a perennial herb that is often found in fynbos vegetation.
